tt:div.tt:p:
MAN: Lemme go! You have no
jurisdiction over me! I'm a
Canadian citizen!

LANA: Yeah, and we're taking you
to Canada, so --

CYRIL: That's why I said sorry
in advance

LANA: And you have to have to
stop yelling "extraordinary
rendition."

I swear to God,
if you scuff my bags...

GEORGE: Oh,
I wouldn't dream of it, ma'am.

MALORY: And I can do without the
sarcasm.

GEORGE: Oh, no ma'am,
that wasn't --

Ugh, Lana,
maybe you can talk to him.

- LANA: Um?!
- MALORY: So this is
the infamous Kenny Bilcoe?

You don't look like much of a
terrorist...

BILCOE: That's because I'm a
freedom fighter!

For a free and sovereign Nova
Scotia!

LANA: Is that why you blew up a
donut shop?

If you believe Canada's
illegitimate,
so-called "government!"
CYRIL: I'm pretty sure we do...

MALORY: Which is why we're
taking you back to Ottawa.

And once we do,
hopefully the Mounties will

start sending us all kinds of
lucrative work.

PAM: Speaking of work,
can I put what I just assume is

your rock collection on the
stupid train?

MALORY: You want to get on that
train so you can stowaway!

CYRIL: Well,
I doubt she'll make it on now...

GEORGE: Need to get these bags
on, ma'am.

LANA: Malory,
don't call him that...

GEORGE: My name actually is
George.

MALORY: Dammit,
I told Sterling six o'clock!

ARCHER: I thought you
meant six a.m.!

MALORY: No,
six -- Sterling are you drunk?

MALORY: You knew we were
transporting a dangerous
terrorist to Canada!

So how and why are you drunk at
six o'clock?

ARCHER: Well the how's pretty
self-explanatory,

and the why is because, hic,
I thought we were leaving at six
a.m.

Ergo, Latin,
plenty of time to sleep it off.

LANA: Well drink some coffee,
because there's a good chance
Bilcoe's terrorist pals --

LANA: -- are going to attack the
train at some point,
and try to bust him loose.

MALORY: I'm sorry,
how is that "awesome?"

ARCHER: Because, hic,
pretty much my whole life I've

wanted to fight some guys on the
roof of a speeding train.

BILCOE: Well if I know my boys,
you may just get your wish,
big guy.

ARCHER: Please tell me he's a
renowned chicken-and-waffle
chef.

BILCOE: So listen, you look like
a pretty smart guy...

CYRIL: Well thanks,
I like to think so...

BILCOE: So why dontcha do
yourself a pretty-smart-guy
favor and just let me go?

CYRIL: Uh,
because Ms. Archer would kill
me?

BILCOE: Well what do ya think's
gonna happen when my boys storm
this train?

CYRIL: Oh,
I'm not too worried about that.

Oh,
and don't forget about Archer.

CYRIL: He may have seemed drunk,
but he's --

ARCHER: Relax,
Lana it's just a bloody mary.
And by the way, not a great one.

LANA: Archer,
at any time in the next twelve

hours this train could be
attacked by radical Nova Scotian
separatists.

Pamphlets about Canada's
responsible gun control laws?

LANA: (annoyed sigh) The New
Scotland Front has guns,

and they're not afraid to use
them, so --

(to bartender) Hey Heinz 56,
can I get an Irish coffee.

- LANA: No!
- ARCHER: Lana,
I have to taper off.

Trust me,
if these Noma Scojens are a real

threat,
you do not want me hungover.

LANA: Do you even still get
hangovers?

ARCHER: Normally no,
but I drank about two gallons of
mamajuana this afternoon.

I was playing dominoes with a,
Dominican bike gang,
or was it Mahjong.

MALORY: This thing's a sardine
can. How are people supposed to
travel like this?

GEORGE: Most people bring less
luggage.

So your days of sullen
superiority are numbered.

GEORGE: I have no response to
that.

Now let's go find a bigger
compartment.

GEORGE: I'm afraid there aren't
any.

MALORY: Nonsense,
I'm sure there's one here
somewhere.

MALORY: What I mind is your
familiar tone, young man.

GEORGE: Those are private cars,
ma'am.

Not for you to be
knocking on!
Now I have to insist that you --

I want this train
stopped immediately and this
stowaway forcibly disembarked!

GEORGE: Afraid I can't do that,
ma'am.

MALORY: You can and you will,
or I'll have your job!
MALORY: What are you doing here?

- CHERYL/CAROL: Uh,
trying to perform my ablutions?
- MALORY: But --

GEORGE: This is Miss Tunt's
private car.

MALORY: How do you have a
private train car?

PAM: Uh,
cause she owns the railroad?

And I knew you wouldn't let us
go on this stupid trip to

Canada, so I had my
cars hooked up.

CHERYL/CAROL: This car,
two sleeping cars,

a private dining car,
and one that's just a teeny tiny
skating rink.

Do you think there might be room
for --

GILLETTE: It's already cramped
back there,

CHERYL/CAROL: Plus George says
you stiffed him.
No I didn't, I gave him a tip!

GILLETTE: Did you not have a
button?

CHERYL/CAROL: Oh we don't know
the meaning of private,
lets all pile in.

LANA: Amazing, Archer, yes,
so you think we can go guard the
prisoner now, or --

LANA: Cyril, why are you in
here?

CYRIL: I didn't know where
you guys were.

LANA: It doesn't matter where we
are, Newb Gingrich --

CYRIL: Although he doesn't seem
to be in here now.

ARCHER: Well he's not gonna jump
off a train going eighty miles
an hour, so --

We'll sweep car by car,
moving from front to back.

ARCHER: Good, you guys do that,
I'll get a big raw steak from
the kitchen.

LANA: (weary sigh) Are you
talking about the ocelot?

LANA: I'm talking about the
prisoner!

ARCHER: Oh.
Well, maybe they're together.

Although I doubt it,
Babou's kind of a loner.

If Paul Newman had
constantly sprayed piss all
over, um...

LANA: Sorry for the
intrusion, folks.

Nothing to worry about,
just some standard, um...

LANA: Okay,
that's all the regular cars.

Now we get to search all the
sleeper cars,
thanks to your incompetence.

CYRIL: Well you left me
unsupervised.
LANA: So this is my fault?

LANA: Fifty-fifty you
accidentally shoot somebody,
Newb.

Now come on,
it'll take us all night to
search this damn train.

CYRIL: Well,
but with Archer helping...

LANA: I wouldn't exactly call it
helping.

ARCHER: Excuse me,
is there an ocelot in there?

GEORGE: No no no,
what're you doing?

Besides making a mess all over
my train?

ARCHER: Looking for a terrorist
and an ocelot --

ARCHER: -- not necessarily in
that order.

GEORGE: Okay that's it,
we're stopping.

Frank,
this is George, we gotta --

He's gotta keep the train at top
speed so they can't get off.
So tell him to keep it floored.
GEORGE: I will do no such thing.

ARCHER: Okay then here,
hold this?

GEORGE: Why are you giving me a
-- oh my!

ARCHER: Sorry,
but I'm not letting a terrorist
escape.

And obviously an ocelot wouldn't
survive in the frozen wasteland
of upstate New York.

GEORGE: Sorry Frank, uh,
Miss Tunt says she wants to beat
the record run to Ottawa.

BILCOE: Okay boys,
make sure you bring the heavy

stuff, cause these
crazy ISIS bastards
aren't playing...

BILCOE: They just killed a black
guy.

MALORY: I treat all servants
exactly the same,
regardless of their race.

LANA: Hang on,
I hear freedom ringing.

Cyril and I searched the front
half of the train,

but we didn't see any sign of
Bilcoe, okay so --

MALORY: I bet it's hard to see
anything from that high horse...

Unless Archer found Bilcoe in
the back half of the train...
Yeah, but it's from a cow.

ARCHER: And Bilcoe's not in the
back half,
so you guys must've missed him.

ARCHER: Which, yes,
obviously you did --

Because there's no way he got
off, we're moving too fast.

CHERYL/CAROL: Oh my God we
totally are!

We might beat the
record run!

You guys probably don't
understand because don't own a
railroad?

But it's actually a pretty huge
deal.

CHERYL/CAROL: We're a pretty
competitive bunch.
No means no, now stop it!

PAM: Bawk bawk bawk bawk bawk
bawk!

Goddammit Pam I don't wanna
race!

ARCHER: I can't believe you have
a skating rink train car.

CHERYL/CAROL: Yeah,
apparently my great-grampa was
nuts for skating.

LANA: I -- okay,
so let's try this again.

Car by car,
this time back to front.

MALORY: Good,
because Miss Stingy here won't

let me eat in her private dining
car --

CHERYL/CAROL: Oh my God we've
been over thaaaat...

MALORY: -- so when you pass the
dining car,

have a porter bring me a Cobb
salad.

LANA: Before or after we locate
the dangerous terrorist?

ARCHER: Sorry folks, uh,
go back to sleep.

LANA: (low, fake cheery) Yeah,
just disregard the gun-toting

spies and the blood smeared
everywhere.

ARCHER: Oh yeah,
keep an eye out for pawprints.

ARCHER: Yeah,
I assume at some point he'll
come out to like...

LANA: (annoyed sigh) Come on,
we've only searched two cars,
so we've got a shitload to go.

CYRIL: Uh, speaking of,
I need to make use of the
facilities here...
LANA: Fine, but catch up, okay.

ARCHER: Yeah,
they look just like prints from

a housecat,
only bigger and awesomer.

BILCOE: Hey,
welcome to the bathroom.

BILCOE: I can tell you never
played much hockey, huh?

Probably too busy runnin around
shootin black guys.
I'll see ya at the border!

LANA: Archer,
we don't have time for this.

ARCHER: It'll take like,
two seconds!

GEORGE: I am not taking that
woman a salad,
Cobb or otherwise.

ARCHER: George, trust me,
you don't want to see my mother
with low blood sug --

ARCHER: Wait,
why are we slowing down?

- GEORGE: We're at the border.
- ARCHER: Of?

GEORGE: Uh, this new place,
called Canada?

GEORGE: So, customs,
passport control, immigration?

LANA: They still guard the
border!

ARCHER: Lana,
we're going into Canada!

LANA: (to George) Okay,
can you please explain to him --

LANA: Okay,
already knowing your answer,

I'm going to ask,
"Don't do what."

ARCHER: Make this a weird racial
thing.
LANA: I knew, and yet I asked...

ARCHER: What,
I just don't wanna be ganged up
on!

GEORGE: I'm gonna back way up,
and not be in here when the

mounties catch you crazy people
with all those guns.

ARCHER: What, they're Canadian,
they don't even know what a gun
-- oh, shit!

ARCHER: That what's the perfect
disguise for some terrorists who

want to board a train to bust
loose another terrorist?

MOUNTIE ONE: Royal
Canadian Mounted Police, folks.

Please have your
passports and declarations forms
out and ready.

LANA: Yeah,
but what if they're like,
actual real mounties?

ARCHER: Well,
not to belabor the point,
but they'd still be Canadian.

i.e., I doubt we're in any real
danger.

LANA: I swear to God if any of
you Canadian fruitcakes move I

will shoot that stupid hat right
off your head.

MOUNTIE ONE: That,
that's not okay.

MOUNTIE ONE: Maintain the right,
boys.

ARCHER: Whoa, dude,
we're serious, we'll shh --

Thinking terrorists would be
disguised as --

MOUNTIE TWO: Royal
Canadian Mounted Police!

MOUNTIE ONE: Great, good,
we're all mounties,

so no need for a Mexican
standoff, eh?

ARCHER: Oh yah,
hooz aboot ya co-opt s'moor

- ARCHER: Oh, look at that,
the race card...
- LANA: Wh-?

MOUNTIE TWO: Let's all just put
down the guns, boys!

MOUNTIE TWO: Aw jeez,
he sprayed me!

MOUNTIE TWO: Ya, ugh,
he ran right oat past us!

LANA: Please tell me that's a
smoke grenade.

I am literally starving to
death.

We are gonna beat that record,
so put this stupid train in...

In what possible way did that
work?

ARCHER: Umm A,
they're all incapacitated...

ARCHER: And B,
I got to blow up a train.

LANA: But that doesn't help us
find Bilcoe!

- ARCHER: He's right there,
stupid.
- LANA: Wh-?

BILCOE: You drop it,
ya racist bastard!
Wait, how am I a racist?

ARCHER: Shut up and come on and
shut up!

LANA: Wait,
we don't know which Mounties are
the real ones!
Hey, good guys and bad guys!

All of you just got a pretty
huge pass,

so don't make me regret it
later!

ARCHER: I'm taking that as tacit
agreement!

LANA: Cyril,
what the hell are you doing?

ARCHER: When will you not
suck at this?
CYRIL: When you don't suck at...

It's better than starving to
death.

And then somebody get over here
to be my hostage!

PAM: Oh for -- way to man up,
Ray!

GILLETTE: Wh-?
I'm in a wheelchair!

BILCOE: Yeah,
no offense but we're gonna be,

ya know,
running around and stuff?

Paralyzed, but other than that,
fine. Yeah.

ARCHER: Okay, then Lana,
you guard them...

ARCHER: And Cyril,
you keep sliding down the

learning curve like the Banana
Splits.
LANA: And what are you gonna do?

ARCHER: I am going to fulfill my
lifelong dream.
BILCOE: Snap out of it, boys!

BILCOE: I could use some help on
the roof!

ARCHER: Oh my God,
this is gonna be awwshiiiit!

It's like being shot in the eyes
by a...

ARCHER: There, that oughta do
it. Okay, let's try that
agawwwshiit!

All I want is to
fight on top of a train!
Is that too much to ask?

ARCHER: The good news,
is now I'm furious.

BILCOE: So, rethinking this,
huh? On top of the train you're

still like, on the train, plus
you got all -- oh shit!
BILCOE: Plus you got all that.
You're still just on the train.

Although, I guess sometimes
there's a helicopter?

ARCHER: Do you have a
helicopter?

ARCHER: You fired eight rounds,
ultradickhead.

Am I the only person who ever
keeps track of that, -- oww!

ARCHER: Wow,
and I thought I was mad
before...

BILCOE: Why,
didja see some old black lady
sittin in the front of a bus?

ARCHER: What is your deal with
calling me a racist?

ARCHER: That's, oh shit, racist,
jingoist, whatever!

BILCOE: And B,
you murdered the porter!

ARCHER: That was from a steak,
you idiot!
I was trying to catch an ocelot!

MOUNTIE ONE: Hold it right
there, boys!

MOUNTIE TWO: Royal Canadian
Mounted Police!

ARCHER: Dammit,
which are the real ones?

BILCOE: Guess that's for me to
know and you to find out.

ARCHER: Well I'm gonna find out
in like five --

LANA: So yeah,
put that in your little secret

agent notebook,
along with "don't leave
prisoners unsupervised."

There's absolutely no reason to
ever get on top of a moving
train.

CYRIL: Wait,
what if there's a helicopter?
LANA: Ooh, yeah, or a dragon!

CYRIL: Ooh, yeah,
or some sarcasm!
LANA: Ooh, yeah, or hang on!

ARCHER: That's right,
buddy, I goww oww oww oww oww,
Babou no!

LANA: Oh come on,
I wouldn't say it was a complete
failure...

And what parts of this mission
would you call a success?

CHERYL/CAROL: Maybe the part
where my non-recordbreaking
train is totally shit-housed?

CYRIL: Not as
shit-housed as my spleen...

MALORY: Ooh,
or maybe the part where the

mounties will never hire ISIS
again!

PAM: What's it matter,
we're all banned from Canada.

GILLETTE: Au revoir,
sweet man-whores of Montreal...

LANA: Ah, well,
we did help with a major
arrest...

MOUNTIE ONE: Kenny Bilcoe,
you're under arrest for

violation of sections one
through nine of the Canadian
Terrorism Act, buddy.

BILCOE: Sorry to cut into yer
donut supply, boys.
LANA: Oh wait, make that five...

MOUNTIE ONE: Same goes for you
bastards!

MOUNTIE TWO: That's not fair,
you're doin it!

MOUNTIE ONE: And besides
attempted murder on a black guy,

you're under arrest for
violating the Exotic Fish and
Wildlife Importation Act.

MOUNTIE ONE: Plus you already
used that once.

ARCHER: It was good enough to
merit seconds!

ARCHER: Which is just people
talk for awesome, which is what

you are, which is why I was
happy to save your life, buddy.

ARCHER: No don't worry,
probably just thousands of

dollars in fines,
maybe a little jail time,
hopefully just probation.

- BABOU: Rrowr?
- ARCHER: Yes, all of it!
